stories.title: USB4VC: USB Inputs on Retro Computers
The Elite Ukrainian Soldiers Defending the Donbas

stories.text:
And I had that environment friendly “only cable - no plug” USB type C cable (most other phones have plugs with Type A receptacles on their chargers).

Not one charger plug among many other phones in my entire household (including so many relatives attending the two weddings) could accommodate that cable’s Type C plug connector. I somehow managed to keep my phone charged, through two marriage ceremonies in a still-very-rural village in India, by inserting the type C connector of Apple’s brave charging cable in those phones’ type C ports and slow-charging my iPhone which for some reason would always stop at 69% no matter which phone I’m drawing power from.

stories.text: An integrated, seamless, and seemingly very fast TOR-like network relay built into the OS is an amazing feature. Works across iPhone, iPad, and Mac OS. I’m a huge fan and am happy to pay for it.
